Description: Prints the data in the print buffer and feeds  the paper [ n * (vertical or horizontal motion unit)] inches
Print and feed paper n lines
Prints the data in the print buffer and feeds the paper n rows.
Set line spacing using minimum units
Sets line spacing to [ n * (vertical or horizontal motion unit)] inches.
Sets the character spacing for the right side ofthe character to [n x horizontal or vertical motion units].
BIT0=0 - 11/15 cpi 15/20 cpi Character font A selected / BIT0=1 - 18 x 24 14 x 24 Character font B selected. 14 x 24 10 x 24
BIT3=0 - Expanded mode not selected / BIT3=1 - Expanded mode selected
BIT4=0 - Double-height mode not selected / BIT4=1 - Double-height mode selected
BIT5=0 - Double-width mode not selected / BIT5=1 - Double-width mode selected
BIT6=0 - Italic mode not selected / BIT6=1 - Italic mode selected
BIT7=0 - Underline mode not selected / BIT7=1 - Underline mode selected
When the Least Signiicant Bit (LSB) of n is 0, the user-defined character set is cancelled.
When the LSB of n is 1, the user-defined character set is selected.
Y specifies the number of bytes in the vertical direction.
C1 specifies the beginning character code for the deinition, if c2 < c1, the command is not executed. range is from ASCII 0x20(32) to 0x7E (126) (95 characters).
C2 specifies the final code, if c2 < c1, the command is not executed
This command deletes the pattern defined for the speciied character code in the font selected by 0x1B 0x21
When the LSB of n is 0, the emphasized mode is off.
When the LSB of n is 1, the emphasized mode is on.
When the LSB of n is 0, the double-strike mode is off.
When the LSB of n is 1, the double-strike mode is on
PC858 for Euro symbol at position 213
When the LSB of n is 0, the upside-down printing mode is off.
When the LSB of n is 1, the upside-down printing mode is on.
Font A = 11 cpi, Font B = 15 cpi
Font A = 15 cpi, Font B = 20 cp
Font A = 20 cpi, Font B = 15 cpi

Font A = 15 cpi, Font B = 20 cp
Font A = 20 cpi, Font B = 15 cpi

Description: Bits 0 to 3: to select character height (see table 2)

Turn white/black reverse printing mode on/off
When the LSB of n is 0, white/black reverse printing is turned off.
When the LSB of n is 1, white/black reverse printing is turned on.
The distance from the beginning of the line to the print position is [(nL + nH * 256) * (vertical or horizontal motion unit)] inches.

Sets the print vertical position based on the current position by using the horizontal or vertical motion unit. This command sets the distance from the current position to[(nL+ nH* 256) * (horizontal or vertical motion unit)].
n specifies the column number for setting a horizontal tab position calculated from the beginning of the line.k indicates the total number of horizontal tab positions to be set.

Sets the print starting position based on the current position by using the horizontal or vertical motion unit. Sets the distance from the current position to [(nL+ nH * 256) * (horizontal or vertical motion unit)].
The left margin is set to [(nL + nH * 256) * (horizontal motion unit)] inches.
Sets the printing area width [mm] to the area speciied by nL and nH.
8 dot single density nL + nH x 256
8 dot double density nL + nH x 256
24 dot single density (nL + nH x 256) x 3
24 dot double density (nL + nH x 256) x 3
x specifies the number of dots in the horizontal direction. The number of dots in the horizontal direction is x * 8
y specifies the number of dots in the vertical direction. The number of dots in the vertical direction is y * 8
xL, xH selects the number of data bits (xL + xH * 256) in the horizontal direction for the bit image
yL, yH selects the number of data bits (yL + yH * 256) in the vertical direction for the bit image
Enable / disable automatic FULL STATUS back
BIT0=0 Disable paper status / BIT0=1 Enable paper status
BIT1=0 Disable user status / BIT1=1 Enable user status
BIT2=0 Disable Recoverable Error Status / BIT2=1 Enable Recoverable Error Status
BIT3=0 Disable Unrecoverable Error Status / BIT3=1 Enable Unrecoverable Error Status

Parameter Name: Different set of data for each function

Description: n specifies the bar code width (referred to the narrow bar) 0,125
r specifies the number of times to execute the macro.
t specifies the waiting time for executing the macro. Interval of (t * 100 msec.) after a macro is executed by t
When the LSB of m = 0, the macro is executed r times continuously at the interval speciied by t.

When the LSB of m = 1, after waiting for the period specified by t, the LED indicator blinks and the printer waits for the FEED button to be pressed. After the button is pressed, the printer executes the macro once. The printer repeats the operation r times.
